ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I used this course as a chance to learn how to build an app.
I learned how to use Google better, as well as how to work on something with no prior knowledge. It was a tough process, but ultimately rewarding.
Learned how to conduct research in CS

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The directed research is what you make of it.
It varies from professor to professor, but personally, my professor could not have been more supportive or helpful.

The major strength is that you have the opportunity to learn about a new field in CS. Pick a research project that interests you or helps you learn something new. You have to motivated or else you won't make any progress.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have a research or project idea, definitely.
I would recommend doing research for credit if you want to give it a try. It could be a little daunting at first depending on what you are choosing to work on, but it can be fulfilling.
If you want to learn about research in a CS field, then yes.

I think this is a great program. You must be comftorable setting your own research goals and working towards them. If you space things out right, this should not take more time than a typical class. I was also not bound to the specific deliverables I set in the beginning of the semester, so if things don't work out or your initial goals were too ambitious, you will be able to to adapt and still pass.
Yes - great way to improve skills in CS and robotics
